Class ThreadSaver

java.lang.Object
ThreadSaver
public class ThreadSaver
extends java.lang.Object
Class definition that assigns a range, name, array, and saves the sum of the specified range of the array.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ThreadSaver()
    Default constructor for testing purposes.
    ThreadSaver​(double lower, double upper, java.lang.String name, int[] intArray)
    Constructor for a ThreadSaver object.

  • Constructor Details

    • ThreadSaver

      public ThreadSaver()
      Default constructor for testing purposes.

    • ThreadSaver

      public ThreadSaver​(double lower, double upper, java.lang.String name, int[] intArray)
      Constructor for a ThreadSaver object.
      Parameters:
      lower - Lower bound of the range, between 0-1 and less than Upper.
      upper - Upper bound of the range, between 0-1 and greater than Lower.
      name - Name of the ThreadSaver, for example: "Quarter1".
      intArray - It requires the array.

  • Method Details

    • getIsRunning

      public boolean getIsRunning()
      This method returns the value of the isRunning boolean.
      Returns:
      This returns a boolean value of whether or not the thread is still running.

    • setRunning

      public void setRunning​(boolean running)
      This method is how the thread running state can be changed.
      Parameters:
      running - Requires a boolean parameter (true/false).

    • getLower

      public double getLower()
      This returns the lower bound value.
      Returns:
      This returns the lower bound value.

    • setLower

      public void setLower​(double lower)
      This sets the lower bound value. The parameter must be between 0-1.
      Parameters:
      lower - Requires a parameter between 0-1.

    • getUpper

      public double getUpper()
      This returns the upper bound.
      Returns:
      This returns the upper bound.

      This sets the upper bound value. The parameter must be between 0-1.
      Parameters:
      upper - Requires a parameter between 0-1.

      intArray - Requires an int[] array that will be assigned as the array.

    • getBegin

      public long getBegin()
      Getter method for the begin time.
      Returns:
      Returns the time that the thread began.

    • getEnd

      public long getEnd()
      Getter method for the end time.
      Returns:
      Returns the time that the thread ended.
